description: Number of digits of n which are divisors of n.
links: Reinhard Zumkeller, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
example: a(35)=1 because 5 is a divisor of 35 but 3 is not
prog: (Haskell)import Data.Char (digitToInt)a038769 n = length $ filter (== 0)            $ map ((mod n) . digitToInt) $ filter (> '0') $ show n-- _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Jun 19 2011
author: _Henry Bottomley_, May 04 2000
